item.title: Observations from China and Taiwan: Giant Clothes for a Giant
item.description: Like many Americans, I’ll admit I was intimidated by the idea of visiting China. For starters there’s the distanceâ€”a twelve-hour slug across the Pacific. That’s twelve long hours of cold rolls and a stiff back. Then there’s those annoying prerogatives of the state bureaucracy: visa restrictions, limits on where you can go as a tourist in China, and various proofs of personhood and plans. And for the technologically mindful, in China 2025 there is the reality of digital surveillance.
